topic: People (A Family Member You Are Proud Of)

l1_part2_questions.question: Describe a family member who you are proud of.
l1_part2_questions.model_answer: To commence, I wish to describe my father, who is undoubtedly the most Diligent [勤奋的] and Accomplished [成功的] person I know. He works incredibly hard every day to support my studies and future, which is truly Inspiring [鼓舞人心的] to me. Since he is deeply Devoted [忠诚的] to our family, he is always Considerate [体贴的] of my feelings, although he can be quite strict about my school grades. He is Selfless [无私的] in his actions and truly has A heart of gold [心地善良]. He is Generous [慷慨的] with his limited free time and is always willing to Go the extra mile [加倍努力] to help me with difficult math problems. I Look up to [敬仰] him greatly.

l1_part2_questions.question: Describe a family member who has achieved something great.
l1_part2_questions.model_answer: I have chosen to discuss my cousin, who is a highly Accomplished [成功的] pianist in our city. Her Diligent [勤奋的] daily practice routine is very Inspiring [鼓舞人心的] to me as a student. Even though she is extremely busy with concerts, she is Generous [慷慨的] enough to teach me piano, which clearly shows she has A heart of gold [心地善良]. She is Devoted [忠诚的] to her art but always remains Considerate [体贴的] of her neighbors' need for quiet. She is Selfless [无私的] in sharing her success with others. I Look up to [敬仰] her ability to Go the extra mile [加倍努力] for musical perfection.

l1_part2_questions.question: Describe a family member you admire for their personality.
l1_part2_questions.model_answer: I wish to describe my grandmother, who is an incredibly Considerate [体贴的] and Selfless [无私的] woman. She is completely Devoted [忠诚的] to taking care of us every single day. Because she has A heart of gold [心地善良], she is always Generous [慷慨的] with her delicious food, whereas others might save it for themselves. Her life story is Inspiring [鼓舞人心的] because she was Diligent [勤奋的] and became Accomplished [成功的] despite growing up in extreme poverty. I Look up to [敬仰] her inner strength. She always tries to Go the extra mile [加倍努力] to make sure I am happy and full.

l2_part3_questions.question: What would children do to make their parents proud?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: It is my firm belief that children can make their parents proud by becoming independent and accepting their parents' Guidance [指导]. Parents spend years trying to Instill [灌输] good values and morals in us, so seeing us succeed on our own is their greatest reward. Unless we show respect for their efforts by living responsibly, we cannot maintain lasting family peace or make them truly happy.

l2_part3_questions.question: What did you do to make your parents proud when you were young?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: Personally, I strove to keep Harmony [和谐] at home by being responsible and studying hard. My father was the main Breadwinner [养家糊口的人] and worked very long hours for us, so I didn't want to cause him any extra stress. Since he was often tired, I did chores to help him relax and feel proud of my maturity.

l2_part3_questions.question: What advantages of yours make you proud?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: I take great pride in my unique Perspective [观点/视角] on life and my optimism. I tend to Appreciate [感激/欣赏] small things that other people might miss, which helps me stay happy during difficult times. Although I am still young, I think deeply about the world around me and try to find the positive side of every situation.

l2_part3_questions.question: When was the last time that you felt proud of yourself?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: A moment of immense pride occurred when I successfully bridged a Generation gap [代沟] with my grandma. We disagreed on gaming, but I explained it patiently to her until she understood my hobby. Provided that we communicate openly, we can understand each other's different views and maintain a loving relationship despite our age difference.

l2_part3_questions.question: How does family pride contribute to the stability of a society?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: Inherently, family pride ensures people act responsibly and care for their reputation in public. As they say, The apple doesn't fall far from the tree [有其父必有其子], meaning children reflect their parents' behavior. When parents set a good example, children usually follow suit in society, which reduces crime and increases overall stability.

l2_part3_questions.question: Do you think the definition of "success" within families has changed between the past and the present?
l2_part3_questions.model_answer: Unquestionably, in contemporary society success is about happiness, not just money or status. We want our Flesh and blood [骨肉/亲人] to be mentally healthy and safe rather than just rich. Whereas in the past parents wanted us to Follow in someone's footsteps [继承衣钵], now they let us choose our own path.
